keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the bass player of Limp Bizkit, died on Saturday, October 19, 2025, according to social media posts by band members.
The band praised Rivers as 'pure magic' and 'the soul in the sound,' highlighting his irreplaceable contribution to their music.
Fred Durst, the band's front man, expressed deep personal grief, saying he has shed 'gallons and gallons of tears' and that Rivers had a profound impact on music and the world.
Rivers had a history of heavy drinking leading to liver disease, underwent a liver transplant in 2018, and returned to the band in 2018 after leaving in 2015.
Limp Bizkit, which originated in Jacksonville, Florida, blends alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap, with a signature off-the-wall humor in album titles and song titles.
The band is scheduled to begin a tour in Central and South America in late November 2025, which will take place after the news of Rivers' death.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the bassist of the nu metal band Limp Bizkit, has died, according to social media posts by band members. The band, which emerged from Jacksonville, Florida in the late 1990s with a fusion of alternative rock, heavy metal, and rap, has publicly mourned his death, calling him 'the soul in the sound' and praising his unmatched talent. Rivers, 48, had struggled with liver disease due to heavy drinking, underwent a transplant in 2018, and returned to the band in 2018. The band’s frontman, Fred Durst, expressed deep personal grief, citing their early meeting in Jacksonville Beach as a pivotal moment. Limp Bizkit continues its musical journey with a scheduled tour in Central and South America beginning in late November 2025, demonstrating both the impact of Rivers’ legacy and the enduring vitality of the band.
